column2: CENTUM T&S, headquartered in France, is a business unit of Centum Electronics Group (Around 1000Cr turnover organization) offering a wide range of electronic and embedded systems design engineering services to international customers to help them realize complex products and sub systems. It includes design, development, qualification, value engineering, testbench design & manufacturing and many more services. Centum T&S has established its India operations in North Bengaluru, known as Centum T&S Pvt Ltd (CTS), formerly known as Centum Adeneo India Pvt Ltd. CTS is working with many top companies like Airbus, Thales, Hitachi Energy, GE, ABB, DANA, Alstom, etc., CTS has ambitious plans to grow to about 250 people by December 2024, delivering best-in-class electronics systems, designed to global standards based on customer specifications The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, multi-tasker, and demonstrated team-player. You will be responsible for the delivery of the items assigned to you with quality and should interact with cross functional team and resolve the problem. You should excel in working with global stakeholders and have outstanding communication and leadership skills and report to the Project Manager.  What You'll Do Lead and manage projects and coordinate work of cross-functional project team/s. Motivate and monitor internal and/or external resources to accomplish all tasks and milestones. Support Proposals and Project execution of Full Product development projects which includes Hardware, Software, FPGA and Test Bench development starting from Project Initiation until closure. Build the existing team technical competencies to deliver projects as per schedule & Customer Quality Requirements thus meeting / exceeding Customer expectations. Ensure robust project plans are developed and updated for each project. Establish, Monitor and report KPIs to different stakeholders. Take responsibility for ensuring that relevant Gate checklists & reports are completed. Prepare regular updates/reports to update the project status to Management Pro-actively drive & manage all technical aspects of project, like Requirements, Design, Code and Test Development, Tooling readiness and ensure these are constantly tracked to minimize any slippages. Work with relevant Cross functions (Supply chain, Manufacturing, Quality, Process & Equipment engineering team) to ensure that the priorities are understood and that capabilities exist across all relevant functions to deliver on time. Ensure transparency around project change requests, unforeseen results/events and identified risks and ensure that they are properly managed and communicated. Ensure that all opportunities are captured and acted upon. Serve as the key contact for stakeholders, and an escalation point for Technical and project management issues. Effectively communicate appropriate information to stakeholders in a timely manner and to achieve desired understanding and support. Allocate resources to work on multiple projects based on work load and setting clear priorities when juggling between multiple projects. Engage with Customer on Technical Qualifications / Resolving Technical Issues / Providing value added suggestions / solutions to complex technical problems. Establish / Enhance systems and processes to continuously improve the team performance and deliver world class NPI experience to customers. Key values, beliefs, and attitudes  Results-orientation: Focus on Customers, provide solutions to customers working with technical team. Establish trust, responsive to change/adaptability; learn continuously/improvement-orientation, proactive, positive & joyful. Who You Are? Bachelors Degree in Engineering. Overall 12+ years of experience of which 5+ years of proven ability to manage Cross Functional Teams & Multiple Projects at the same time.  Has Min 3+ years of Project Management Experience on different Hardware Projects including FPGA. Preferably full product development projects. Has good exposure to manage different project management lifecycle activities and has good expertise in handling different gate reviews at Equipment/Hardware/SW lifecycle development Experience in working with cross functional teams in multisite environment across different geographies PMP/Prince/Agile Certification Preferred. Self-motivated, able to take the initiatives / decisions on resolving critical issues with relevant stakeholders. Good communication skills  able to express opinions/judgements clearly, make presentations and communicate confidently with customer. Presents complex problems succinctly. Motivate, influence and coach others to sets high standards regarding the work ethics and inspires others to achieve the stretch goals / customer requirement.
column11: Project Management, Project Engineering, Hardware Design

column2: What you??l do:       Do you love building best-in-class solutions that help solve consumer problems while providing smart energy management and excellent comfort? Eaton's Residential Connected Solutions (CS) Team is looking for a technology leader for our cross functional team comprising of Firmware, Hardware, Cloud SW, Mobile App Development, DevSecOps and QA. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record of building and scaling technology teams and delivering cutting edge IoT solutions that leverage electromechanical, hardware, firmware, cloud, data, and mobile technologies. The leader needs to provide strategic leadership on Innovation, solution definition to delivery, following Agile practices, drive continuous improvement and sustenance of the solution. The leader shall shape up the proposals with deep system understanding and strong consumer centricity, to make the CS portfolio rich, venture into new use cases and drive the best-in-class solutions. Enrich & foster climate of innovation to drive growth & accelerate capability development. ?Collaborate with global product engineering teams and internal / external stakeholders to perform system development activities during project execution. Perform technical reviews, including detailed design reviews. Help drive the roadmap and achieve leadership position in ?key focus areas on Next Generation Connected Solutions (Home Energy Management) and drive the strategy on Home as a grid through Eaton offerings.            Qualifications:       Bachelors in Engg Electrical/Electronics/IT or similar.   ??5+ years of overall experience including 6+ years of experience as Manager and 6+ years of hands-on expertise in one of the technologies like Hardware design, Firmware development for IoT solutions ??xperience in managing cross functional teams (including hardware, firmware, software) and delivering products from ideation to production. ??xcellent strategic intent, linking customer and business requirements to technology roadmap ??trong expertise in capability, competency and capacity building for Connected IoT products cutting across multiple functional domains, including V&V and lab infrastructure. ??ead & execute global programs with Engineering leadership from Pune ??anages department budget and performance to forecast ??rives and promotes innovation rigor in the team in order to create technical differentiators and new value propositions. Provide growth opportunities and protect IP through patents and trade secrets ??nsure Eaton stays abreast of new and emerging technologies to design and evaluate product integrity in order to facilitate rapid deployment. ??nderstand customer requirements and communicate them to teams, and act as the liaison for program activities as appropriate. ??rains, develops and motivates subordinates to achieve their performance goals and review their accomplishments and conducts performance reviews. Recruit and retain a team of engineers.? ??onitors progress and achievements on projects. Provide regular reports on development and support activities. ??trong process knowledge of IoT product development and integration of multiple sub-systems ??eview technical concepts of projects and enable execution; Synergizes and leverages engineering capabilities across groups.? ??anages and develops people: identifies, attracts and develops key engineering talent for the organization. ??xcellent communications skills, global exposure, high degree of aptitude, creativity is required.? ??trong collaboration with industrialization teams and enable end to end product development (customer requirements to manufacturing). Desired: ??FSS certification; Agile certification ??igital mindset with knowledge of Digital tools that aid core product development and digitalization of next gen products.            Skills:       Leading team in agile atmosphere, creating technical proposals, stakeholder communication, process definition

column2: A GRL Hardware Engineering Internship is a great opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience and exposure testing, diagnosing, and developing automated test solutions to address signal integrity, protocol and system application-level engineering challenges     GRL Interns work with state-of-the-art test equipment on the latest muti-gigabit technologies, supporting customers ranging from start-ups to the largest players from the Silicon to System level, while being trained and mentored by seasoned experts             Responsibilities:            Operate state-of-the-art Test Equipment (i.e. pattern generators, oscilloscopes, VNA, and logic analyzers).      Setup and perform high-speed SERDES as well as a final product electrical PVT characterization measurements to support current and new product development.      Setup and perform system protocol, interoperability, and functional testing.      Record and analyze test data and prepare test reports.      Support test automation product development and validation                Qualifications:            Demonstrated academic achievement in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or relevant subject area.      Desire to gain technical depth in relevant technologies, testing process, and equipment.      Lab experience with test equipment listed above is a big plus.      Programming knowledge of C/C++, Python, LabView, Matlab, and other languages a big plus      Knowledge of any Industry Standard Interface is a big plus      Strong knowledge of with Microsoft Office products, especially Word and Excel.      Excellent interpersonal and listening skills; quick learner.      Strong organizational skills, high integrity, and excellent work ethic.

column2: Purpose of the Job He/she defines the architecture and functionalities of a TC&IS subsystem (ATP/ATO, Train Radio, Event recorder, Train Ground Communication, ATC/Safety equipment, RS to S & T Communication/ICD, TPS) in compliance with the different requirements He/she ensures the integration into the train Ensure SMARTSys or Supplier follow up. Position in the Organisation Organisation Reporting Hierarchical : Site TC&IS Metier Manager Functional : Project Engineering Manager (PrEM), SSM, Train System Engineer (TSE), Train Control Engineer( TCE) of the Project Peers:  EDU managers of other Train Control Functions  Traction/Brake/HVAC/CCTV/PIES/Doors Team Size:  Heading the team of 8-12 system engineers Network & Links Project Engineering Manager (PrEM) Train System Engineer (TSE) /Train Design Engineer (TDE) RAMS, SLI, Quality Internal or external suppliers Certification & Validation Schematic & Apparatus team Interior Engineer TC&IS team RAMS Engineer /Validation Engineer Responsibilities Accountable for : Delivering the subsystem documentation (Requirement Specification and Architecture Description RSAD, Technical Purchase Specification TPS, Interface Control Document ICD). Responsible for : Defining and implementing the functional, performance, transverse and train level requirements of the dedicated subsystem.  Integrating the subsystem into the train (mechanically and electrically) Defining the Interface (mechanical and electrical) for the dedicated subsystem.  Verifying of the subsystem (focus on train level) including design reviews. Change and configuration management process for the subsystem on train level.  Control of changes after design changes including impact analysis.  Planning and follow up of all activities linked to the subsystem. Support sourcing, suppliers, PUs, S&A Engineers, Interior engineers, RAMS engineers, and validation engineers. Providing inputs to engineering team, sourcing, suppliers or Pus Knowledge & Experience 10+ years of experience in Signalling concept and relevant interfaces with Rolling stock with the dedicated subsystems like ATP/ ATO, Event Recorder, Train Radio etc in rail Business. Understanding of the system engineering process and mastering a system engineering methodology (e.g. SysML) Fluent English

column2: Siemens EDA is a global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation software.      Our software tools enable companies around the world to develop highly innovative electronic products faster and more efficiently.      Our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics to deliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board, and system design.     Aprisa offers complete functionality for top-level hierarchical design and block-level implementation for complex digital IC designs.     The detail-route-centric architecture and hierarchical database enable fast design closure and efficient quality of results at a driven runtime.     This role is based in Bangalore. But you ll also get to visit other locations in India and globe, so you ll need to go where this job takes you. In return, you ll get the chance to work with teams impacting entire cities, countries, and the shape of things to come.     This is your role:      Working on 7nm and 5nm designs with various customers for deployment of Aprisa place and route tools.     Are you expertised in solving customers problems for critical designs to achieve desired performance, area and power targets!     Responsible to develop flow and methodology for doing placement, CTS and routing. Also, provide training and technical support to customers using Aprisa tools       We don t need superheroes, just superminds!       Typically requires minimum of 6-10 years of experience in Physical Design with mainstream PR tools     We are looking for someone with hands on experience in Physical Design (floorplan, placement, CTS and routing) and timing closure of complex blocks and/or Full Chip designs.     Hands-on experience with commercial place route tools like Synopsys-lCC2, Cadence-Innovus or Aprisa is a must.     Tapeout experience of 2 or more projects is a must.     Do you have good understanding of timing, power and area trade-offs    Ability to pickup new flows, learn on the job and influence QOR is a must.     We are looking for an experienced design delivering with multiple voltage islands and top-level floor-planning chip-assembly is a plus.     Strong verbal and written communication skills; good presentation skills; good problem solving and debugging skills.     Education:      BE/B.Tech in Electronics and Communication (EC) or Electrical or Telecom Engineering     ME/M.Tech in VLSI or Microelectronics is a plus
column11: Automation, Timing closure, VLSI, Debugging, Siemens, System design, Healthcare, Technical support, Physical design, Lead Member Technical Staff

column2: What you'll do:  The position is for a Hardware Development Engineer in the Lenovo Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG), based in Bangalore, Karnataka. ?This is an exciting role in the ThinkSystem Server Development organization that has a strong focus to be the #1 trusted IT Partner in the Datacenter market. ?The hardware development engineer will be an integral member of a team responsible for developing innovative and complex server designs to meet customer and business needs.? These organic designs provide exposure to the latest technologies from Lenovo and its development partners to meet market demands.? The role also entails solving unique client challenges through the custom development of solutions. ? Required skills : Bachelors Degree in Electronics/Computer Engineering.? 17+ years of in-depth experience in x86 architecture and hardware design.? Server design experience is strongly preferred. Knowledge and design experience of DDR, PCIe, USB, Ethernet, SPI, I2C along with High-speed PCB design and signal integrity will be an essential requirement. Experience in  EDA schematic design tools for PCB schematic creation, supporting physical/ Layout design activity, hardware bring-up and validation will be required. Responsible for translating business/customer requirements into platform architecture encompassing hardware, software, SoCs, and other components designed to support a variety of systems, solutions, and applications. Design, develop, and analyze overall platform architecture and partitioning between hardware and software to meet use cases and workloads in terms of performance, scalability, manageability, reliability, and security requirements Leads architectural governance and decisions related to product technology and platform tradeoffs as part of a cross-functional architecture decision group. Influences the shaping of future products/solutions by significantly contributing to the architecture and technology employed throughout the compute continuum Ability to triage and resolve complex hardware issues, working seamlessly with other engineers on problem investigation. Strong problem-solving skills with an ability to triage and resolve complex hardware issues, working seamlessly with other engineers on problem investigation will be essential. Strong written and verbal communication skills for a variety of tasks, potentially including customer engagements, architecture design/feedback, and executive updates. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in both a team environment and self-directed; passionate about learning new technologies and skills. Preferred skills: Master?? Degree Previous experience in FPGA code development and validation, DC Power circuit design, and/or PCIe bus design, simulation, and validation. Proficiency in Linux/Windows Operating systems. Experience with OS virtualization. Strong proficiency in shell scripting (BASH/Perl/Python and Windows Power Shell) Demonstrated successful hardware design execution on a project with engineering team members located in multiple geographies. Business acumen to engage with various functional teams required to take projects from concept to production.

Key responsibilities: CPU/GPU/AI  Power & Performance execution engineer/Lead Benchmarking CPUs,  GPU, NSP/APU including      analysis with competition. Understand CPU      micro-benchmarks, profiling on  Windows,      Linux environment. Hands-on experience on Silicon/SOC Power and Performance       measurements & optimizations Familiarity with  common Windows & Linux Benchmark  tools such as       3DMark11, PCMark, PassMark, CineBench, CoreMark, SPEC, DPDK, SPDK, FIO Power/Voltage/Frequency/Temperature       characterization Component level power measurements Different OS experience:       Windows/Linux Proficiency in handling lab equipments related to Power profiling, thermal platform and performance analyzers. Familiar with power measurement       tools such as NIDAQ or equivalent power       measurement  adapters Thermal chambers/chillers Able to analyze SoC voltage and clock waveforms  (using oscilloscope, etc) User Experience/Game Performance, and memory utilization for current and next generation      chipsets Develop automation environment  & tools for profiling, validation and debugging across all SOC components

column2: Are you looking for a unique opportunity to be a part of something greatWant to join a 20,000-member team that works on the technology that powers the world around usLooking for an atmosphere of trust, empowerment, respect, diversity, and communicationHow about an opportunity to own a piece of a multi-billion dollar (with a B!) global organizationWe offer all that and more at Microchip Technology, Inc.         People come to work at Microchip because we help design the technology that runs the world. They stay because our culture supports their growth and stability. They are challenged and driven by an incredible array of products and solutions with unlimited career potential. Microchip s    nationally-recognized    Leadership Passage Programs support career growth where we proudly enroll over a thousand people annually. We take pride in our commitment to employee development, values-based decision making, and strong sense of community, driven by our Vision, Mission, and 11 Guiding Values ; we affectionately refer to it as the    Aggregate System    and it s won us countless awards for diversity and workplace excellence.         Our company is built by dedicated team players who love to challenge the status quo; we did not achieve record revenue and over 30 years of quarterly profitability without a great team dedicated to empowering innovation. People like you.         Visit our careers page to see what exciting opportunities and company perks await!                     You will join the silicon characterization team to manage and execute characterization of FPGA products. You will work closely with silicon design engineers, software engineers and technology development engineers to ensure that the company deploys new products with the highest quality and shortest time to market. This position will provide the opportunity to work on multiple projects supporting key functions within the organization.       Lead and manage the characterization team, setting clear objectives and goals     Develop Characterization spec, plan, and documentation     Characterization of Digital and Mixed-signal designs     Associated design and firmware development     Verification of Microchip s FPGA timing and Power analysis tools     Correlation of pre-silicon results with silicon measurements     Cross-functional team interfacing and collaboration in all activities                   Requirements/Qualifications:                   BSEE or MSEE     15+ years of experience in product characterization or silicon validation with emphasis on digital and mixed-signal circuits     5+ years of managing small to medium size teams     Expertise in characterization of SoC, PLL, Oscillators, etc.     Firmware Development on multi-core microcontrollers or processors (ARM/RISC-V or similar)     Knowledge of serial protocol (PCIe/SATA/SDI/SRIO/etc.) and memory interfaces (DDR5/4/3/LPDDR5/4/3/etc.)     Experience working in a laboratory environment, using lab equipment such as BERTs, logic analyzers, spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, function generators, etc.     Experience in evaluation of various laboratory equipment such as BERTs, Oscilloscopes, etc.     Knowledge of electrical engineering fundamentals including CMOS device operation and characteristics     Experience in board design fundamentals, signal and power integrity     Experience with Verilog or VHDL     Exposure to automated characterization flows to maximize use of equipment     Initiative (self-motivated, self-confident, self-driven, self-learning, always striving for excellence)     Commitment (responsible, responsive, commit to winning)     Solid functional and technical skills     Work quality ("do it right the first time", attention to detail, good documentation)     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills     Excellent communication, documentation and presentation skills     Must have strong self-learning ability, leadership, and enjoy working in teams         Preferred Skills:         Knowledge of JTAG protocol highly desirable     Working knowledge of SOC and/or FPGA Architectures     Knowledge of FPGA design synthesis and routing associated with Microchip (Libero), AMD/Xilinx (Vivado, ISE), or Intel/Altera (Quartus) tools     Working knowledge of at least 1 of the following languages: Java/ C/C++, Visual Basic and/or Perl     Analog and mixed signal circuit design. Working experience with analog and/or digital systems is an advantage             Travel Time:         0% - 25%
